Author: skerberus#7584
Content:
First of all thanks for securing the funds Komodo Team! I would like to suggest some changes regarding the claiming, which is currently necessary monthly and is as we can see a risk for the funds.
1. Switch back to yearly (or lesser) claiming in order to avoid that in a security breach many users are in danger. I am an example of a person that only had to be secured because I had to claim.
Of course I unterstand the incentive to have active users, but this also opposes risk as we have seen.
2. Another option is to make ot possible to claim from another address. Some kind of delegating, so if Address A with coins delegates the claim right to B, B can claim but A always gets the funds. In that case we would not have to log into the account withs funds monthly.
3. Create a minimal wallet with as less dependencies as posssible that get's security reviewed and that does not need to get online. That wallet could create an offline transaction to claim and does not need to get updated as often.
Maybe these suggestions can help @komodoteam @jl777c

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@load you have the funds in your own address
1) Download https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.6.0.13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview 
2) It is safe
3) First, create a new wallet (new seed)
4) Note down the address
5) Then import the old seed (compromised), in the Verus Agama wallet and activate KMD lite mode. Then send all the funds to the new KMD address created previously
6) If you face "electrum error", "connection error" or "get_balance error", follow this guide: https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000029569-how-to-stop-agama-from-using-a-proxy-server-to-access-electrum-servers/
7) Uninstall the old version of agama and don't run it again. But please keep a backup of your old(compromised) seed, wif, privkey or anyother way you used to Access your old wallet. See the following article to backup your old access method: https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000024424-how-to-secure-your-wallet-seed-private-keys-wallet-dat-file

Author: JimD#9272
Content: How many coins did hackers get ahold of before KMD team cut them off ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are still trying to assess this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: current estimate is 1 million, but with a big +/- factor

Author: JimD#9272
Content: Ya, in other discords people are posting stuff that says 1 million but sounds like its not settled yet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: until all the claims are in and we analyze each one, we wont have a clear idea

Author: JimD#9272
Content: Its somewhat annoying cause they make it sound like KMD is trying to cover up when we just don't know yet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i estimated 1 million based on the initial data and the fact that 90% of the people whose funds moved ended up in the sweep address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: some trolls make it sound like we shouldnt have rescued the funds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but i know for sure when people think the hacker got their funds they are very sad, but when they find out we rescued it, they are much happier. In 100% of the cases, so i dont care at all what the trolls are saying

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it would help if everyone posted the sane point of view on this to social media

Author: JimD#9272
Content: Yup, I agree.  :Komodo:
